title: Turco-Mongol emperor Timur sacks Damascus.
text: Turco-Mongol emperor Timur sacks Damascus.

title: James VI of Scotland becomes James I of England and Ireland, upon the death of Elizabeth I.
text: James VI of Scotland becomes James I of England and Ireland, upon the death of Elizabeth I.

title: Tokugawa Ieyasu is granted the title of shōgun from Emperor Go-Yōzei, and establishes the Tokugawa shogunate in Edo, Japan.
text: Tokugawa Ieyasu is granted the title of shōgun from Emperor Go-Yōzei, and establishes the Tokugawa shogunate in Edo, Japan.

title: The Province of Carolina is granted by charter to eight Lords Proprietor in reward for their assistance in restoring Charles II of England to the throne.
text: The Province of Carolina is granted by charter to eight Lords Proprietor in reward for their assistance in restoring Charles II of England to the throne.

title: Count Frederick of Hesse-Kassel is elected King of Sweden by the Riksdag of the Estates, after his consort Ulrika Eleonora abdicated the throne on 29 February
text: Count Frederick of Hesse-Kassel is elected King of Sweden by the Riksdag of the Estates, after his consort Ulrika Eleonora abdicated the throne on 29 February

title: Johann Sebastian Bach dedicated six concertos to Margrave Christian Ludwig of Brandenburg-Schwedt, now commonly called the Brandenburg Concertos, BWV 1046–1051.
text: Johann Sebastian Bach dedicated six concertos to Margrave Christian Ludwig of Brandenburg-Schwedt, now commonly called the Brandenburg Concertos, BWV 1046–1051.

title: Naturalization of Hieronimus de Salis Parliamentary Act is passed.
text: Naturalization of Hieronimus de Salis Parliamentary Act is passed.

title: Great Britain passes the Quartering Act, which requires the Thirteen Colonies to house British troops.
text: Great Britain passes the Quartering Act, which requires the Thirteen Colonies to house British troops.

title: In Kraków, Tadeusz Kościuszko announces a general uprising against Imperial Russia and the Kingdom of Prussia, and assumes the powers of the Commander in Chief of all of the Polish forces.
text: In Kraków, Tadeusz Kościuszko announces a general uprising against Imperial Russia and the Kingdom of Prussia, and assumes the powers of the Commander in Chief of all of the Polish forces.

title: The Parliament of the United Kingdom passes the Roman Catholic Relief Act 1829, allowing Catholics to serve in Parliament.
text: The Parliament of the United Kingdom passes the Roman Catholic Relief Act 1829, allowing Catholics to serve in Parliament.

title: In Hiram, Ohio, a group of men beat and tar and feather Mormon leader Joseph Smith.
text: In Hiram, Ohio, a group of men beat and tar and feather Mormon leader Joseph Smith.

title: Canada gives African Canadian men the right to vote.
text: Canada gives African Canadian men the right to vote.

title: Slavery is abolished in Venezuela.
text: Slavery is abolished in Venezuela.

title: Sakuradamon Incident: Assassination of Japanese Chief Minister (Tairō) Ii Naosuke.
text: Sakuradamon Incident: Assassination of Japanese Chief Minister (Tairō) Ii Naosuke.

title: The last of Titokowaru's forces surrendered to the New Zealand government, ending his uprising.
text: The last of Titokowaru's forces surrendered to the New Zealand government, ending his uprising.

title: The British frigate HMS Eurydice sinks, killing more than 300.
text: The British frigate HMS Eurydice sinks, killing more than 300.

title: Robert Koch announces the discovery of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, the bacterium responsible for tuberculosis.
text: Robert Koch announces the discovery of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, the bacterium responsible for tuberculosis.

title: Sino-French War: Chinese victory in the Battle of Bang Bo on the Tonkin–Guangxi border.
text: Sino-French War: Chinese victory in the Battle of Bang Bo on the Tonkin–Guangxi border.

title: A. S. Popov makes the first radio signal transmission in history.
text: A. S. Popov makes the first radio signal transmission in history.

title: Mayor of New York City Robert Anderson Van Wyck breaks ground for a new underground "Rapid Transit Railroad" that would link Manhattan and Brooklyn.
text: Mayor of New York City Robert Anderson Van Wyck breaks ground for a new underground "Rapid Transit Railroad" that would link Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: The first issue of the Georgian Bolshevik newspaper Dro is published.
text: The first issue of the Georgian Bolshevik newspaper Dro is published.

title: The 1921 Women's Olympiad begins in Monte Carlo, first international women's sports event.
text: The 1921 Women's Olympiad begins in Monte Carlo, first international women's sports event.

title: Nanking Incident: Foreign warships bombard Nanjing, China, in defense of the foreign citizens within the city.
text: Nanking Incident: Foreign warships bombard Nanjing, China, in defense of the foreign citizens within the city.

title: The Enabling Act passed in both the Reichstag and Reichsrat.
text: The Enabling Act passed in both the Reichstag and Reichsrat.

title: United States Congress passes the Tydings–McDuffie Act, allowing the Philippines to become a self-governing commonwealth.
text: United States Congress passes the Tydings–McDuffie Act, allowing the Philippines to become a self-governing commonwealth.

title: Ardeatine massacre: German troops murder 335 Italian civilians in Rome.
text: Ardeatine massacre: German troops murder 335 Italian civilians in Rome.

title: World War II: In an event later dramatized in the movie The Great Escape, 76 Allied prisoners of war begin breaking out of the German camp Stalag Luft III.
text: World War II: In an event later dramatized in the movie The Great Escape, 76 Allied prisoners of war begin breaking out of the German camp Stalag Luft III.

title: A British Cabinet Mission arrives in India to discuss and plan for the transfer of power from the British Raj to Indian leadership.
text: A British Cabinet Mission arrives in India to discuss and plan for the transfer of power from the British Raj to Indian leadership.

title: Rock 'n' roll teen idol Elvis Presley is drafted in the U.S. Army.
text: Rock 'n' roll teen idol Elvis Presley is drafted in the U.S. Army.

title: Quebec Board of the French Language is established.
text: Quebec Board of the French Language is established.

title: Images from the Ranger 9 lunar probe are broadcast live on network television.
text: Images from the Ranger 9 lunar probe are broadcast live on network television.

title: Kenyan athlete Kip Keino defeats Jim Ryun at the first-ever professional track meet in Los Angeles.
text: Kenyan athlete Kip Keino defeats Jim Ryun at the first-ever professional track meet in Los Angeles.

title: In Argentina, the armed forces overthrow the constitutional government of President Isabel Perón and start a 7-year dictatorial period self-styled the National Reorganization Process.
text: In Argentina, the armed forces overthrow the constitutional government of President Isabel Perón and start a 7-year dictatorial period self-styled the National Reorganization Process.

title: Morarji Desai became the Prime Minister of India, the first Prime Minister not to belong to Indian National Congress.
text: Morarji Desai became the Prime Minister of India, the first Prime Minister not to belong to Indian National Congress.

title: El Salvadorian Archbishop Óscar Romero is assassinated while celebrating Mass in San Salvador.
text: El Salvadorian Archbishop Óscar Romero is assassinated while celebrating Mass in San Salvador.

title: The Loscoe gas explosion leads to new UK laws on landfill gas migration and gas protection on landfill sites.
text: The Loscoe gas explosion leads to new UK laws on landfill gas migration and gas protection on landfill sites.

title: In Prince William Sound in Alaska, the Exxon Valdez spills 240,000 barrels (38,000 m3) of crude oil after running aground.
text: In Prince William Sound in Alaska, the Exxon Valdez spills 240,000 barrels (38,000 m3) of crude oil after running aground.

title: Discovery of Comet Shoemaker–Levy 9.
text: Discovery of Comet Shoemaker–Levy 9.

title: Mitchell Johnson and Andrew Golden, aged 11 and 13 respectively, fire upon teachers and students at Westside Middle School in Jonesboro, Arkansas; five people are killed and ten are wounded.
text: Mitchell Johnson and Andrew Golden, aged 11 and 13 respectively, fire upon teachers and students at Westside Middle School in Jonesboro, Arkansas; five people are killed and ten are wounded.

title: A tornado sweeps through Dantan in India, killing 250 people and injuring 3,000 others.
text: A tornado sweeps through Dantan in India, killing 250 people and injuring 3,000 others.

title: First computer-assisted Bone Segment Navigation, performed at the University of Regensburg, Germany
text: First computer-assisted Bone Segment Navigation, performed at the University of Regensburg, Germany

title: Kosovo war: NATO began attacks on Yugoslavia without United Nations Security Council (UNSC) approval, marking the first time NATO has attacked a sovereign country.
text: Kosovo war: NATO began attacks on Yugoslavia without United Nations Security Council (UNSC) approval, marking the first time NATO has attacked a sovereign country.

title: A lorry carrying margarine and flour catches fire inside the Mont Blanc Tunnel. The resulting inferno kills 38 people.
text: A lorry carrying margarine and flour catches fire inside the Mont Blanc Tunnel. The resulting inferno kills 38 people.

title: The Arab League votes 21–1 in favor of a resolution demanding the immediate and unconditional removal of U.S. and British soldiers from Iraq.
text: The Arab League votes 21–1 in favor of a resolution demanding the immediate and unconditional removal of U.S. and British soldiers from Iraq.

title: Bhutan officially becomes a democracy, with its first ever general election.
text: Bhutan officially becomes a democracy, with its first ever general election.

title: Germanwings Flight 9525 crashes in the French Alps in an apparent pilot mass murder-suicide, killing all 150 people on board.
text: Germanwings Flight 9525 crashes in the French Alps in an apparent pilot mass murder-suicide, killing all 150 people on board.
